title: Confusing error message for `impl Trait` consts/statics that use generics

body:
#53542 introduced `impl Trait` bindings in consts and statics (along with let bindings), but of course they cannot be assigned a value of a generic type. The error message is presently a bit confusing:

```
error[E0434]: can't capture dynamic environment in a fn item
  --> .../bindings.rs:4:29
   |
 4 |     const foo: impl Clone = x;
   |                             ^
   |
   = help: use the `|| { ... }` closure form instead
```

Example:

```rust
#![feature(impl_trait_in_bindings)]

fn a<T: Clone>(x: T) {
    const foo: impl Clone = x;
}
```

A message like `cannot assign value of generic type to const or static of opaque type` would be better, I think (unless there's already a suitable error that can be reused).

See also the [`bindings` test](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/16cf404f9853e716a216be32d05f5215ff821c00/src/test/ui/impl-trait/bindings.rs) from the above PR and its [stderr](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/16cf404f9853e716a216be32d05f5215ff821c00/src/test/ui/impl-trait/bindings.stderr).
